problems.title: Permutations of a String
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given a string S containing distinct characters, generate all possible permutations of S.
The permutations should be printed in lexicographical (alphabetical) order.

Backtracking Approach:
For each position, try every available character that hasn't been used yet.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
abc

Sample Output
abc acb bac bca cab cba

Explanation:
All 6 permutations of "abc" in order.
problems.constraints:
1 <= |S| <= 8
Characters are distinct lowercase English letters.

testCases.expectedOutput: abc acb bac bca cab cba
abcd abdc acbd acdb adbc adcb bacd badc bcad bcda bdac bdca cabd cadb cbad cbda cdab cdba dabc dacb dbac dbca dcab dcba

hintsList: Use backtracking with a 'visited' array to keep track of used characters.
Sort the string first to ensure lexicographical order.
